availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Stogden Brown (Johnson County, Kentucky, minister & county court judge)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, Methodist minister and county court judge. Kentucky native. Son of Francis Asbury Brown and Edy Preston Brown. Married to Emelina R. Brown. Father of George W. Brown, Julia J. Brown, Amanda M. Brown, Angelina R. Brown, Arthur W. Brown, Tabitha I. Brown, Nancy M. Brown, John M. Brown, and Mary A. Brown. Married to Fanny Baldwin Brown on January 19th, 1860. Methodist clergyman in Johnson County in 1850. County court judge and Methodist minister in Johnson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, pp. 85A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 150.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Johnson County Marriages, Film #001912950, p. 94 of 239 of microfilm.
Sons of the American Revolution Membership Applications, 1889-1970. Cincinnati, Ohio: National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution. Microfilm, volume 334, p. 457 of 466 of microfilm (accessed through Ancestry.com on August 5, 2020).
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA, Film 7016191: All Counties, Boyd County, 1913-1919, File #248, p. 353 of 3304 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, “Thomas Stogden Brown (1814-1890)," Memorial 32142636, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/32142636 (accessed August 5, 2020).
